author: Puneet Kollipara
description: Long-lasting oscillations in rainfall make even long records less useful for predicting future extremes.
title: Rainfall Fluctuations Hinder Projections of Future Extremes

author: T. Cook
description: Upper Niger River study shows that satellite altimetry could help resource managers optimize reservoir releases even on ungauged rivers.
title: Satellite Measurements May Help Real-Time Water Management

author: Mark Zastrow
description: The decades-old theory of the layers of the Earth's ionosphere, which dates to 1931, has just received an update that takes into account the angle of the Sun.
title: New Ionosphere Model Incorporates Solar Angles

author: David Shultz
description: Researchers look back in time to help understand our warmer future.
title: Historic Warm Periods Shed Light on Future Cyclones

author: Eric Betz
description: When NASA launched its CALIPSO spacecraft, the space agency did not intend to estimate phytoplankton populations.
title: Hacking a Climate Satellite to See Beneath the Ocean's Surface

author: Puneet Kollipara
description: Reducing the number of fixed assumptions may improve the accuracy of complex process-based models.
title: Inflexibility of Some Hydrological Models Limits Accuracy

author: Kate Wheeling
description: River erosion increased rapidly following rock uplift events in the plateau approximately 11 million years ago.
title: Dynamics of the Earth's Surface in the Eastern Tibetan Plateau

author: Kate Wheeling
description: Multisatellite missions give scientists a more complete view of the intense currents that bounce back and forth along our planet's magnetic field lines.
title: New Insights into Currents in Earth's Magnetic Field

author: Kate Wheeling
description: A detonation of less than 0.03% of the current global nuclear arsenal could cause fires that clog the air with soot. This soot could block solar radiation, leading to worldwide crop shortages.
title: Regional Nuclear War Could Cause a Global Famine

author: Julia Rosen
description: A new method will help scientists monitor the basal melt of ice sheets in Antarctica.
title: Researchers Track Moving Ice Shelves to Estimate Antarctic Ice Loss
